column4: hello everyone...i've got a simple question: is there any application similar to reason, ableton, protools, fruity loops for ubuntu?
hello everyone...i've got a simple question: is there any application similar to reason, ableton, protools, fruity loops for ubuntu?
there is a lot of Linux audio software but most of it is geared up to recording and synthesis
yeah i've been doing that... now i want to have smth like lmms yes (looking at it right now on the web)
no, I don't use computers for music any more
I only use hardware synths and analogue tape
I *should* give lmms a go though
hehe :) i record samples with my el. guitar and synth too...but i don't have any drum machine :) so i need somekind of virtual drum machine to make
I use computers for editing and generally mucking about with samples, though
it is *just* a drum machine, with various sample sets
no clever stuff, just a plain old-fashioned drum machine
now that think of it i think i have it installed already :D
hahaha...it's cool...that's what i've been looking for..thanks alot :) bye
one more question... if u know... can you export loops you make in hydrogen?
